page.title: 05THE RIVER DART
page.content: On the 15th May 1985 we interviewed Mr.Parnell, who has lived in Stoke Gabriel all his life. He is one of the main people in the Boating Association and knows a lot about the river. He has been Chairman of th Parish Council for many years. We asked about the pontoon. It had been there since 1972. It is made of wood and has 64 moorings. On the river there are 6 passenger boats. When you go on a trip on one it takes you up the river towards Totnes. There is a dam on the quay which is to stop the water going out too fast. It has been there for about 250 years. The biggest tide there has ever been was 5.5m. The River Dart is one of the seven rivers with salmon. The biggest ever caught was 52 pounds. MARCUS LUGG.
